main event: On July 6, 1963, a high-intensity light was observed in Sioux City, Iowa, moving in flight on a course of 225Â° at high altitude.
interesting points: The object displayed a flash of light every 2 seconds with no discernible size or shape,The sighting lasted for a duration of 15 minutes with the object moving steadily until it disappeared over the horizon,The observation indicated that there was no maneuverability observed in the object's path,Military personnel speculated that the sighting possibly constituted a threat to security and was likely for reconnaissance or intelligence purposes,The reported object was determined not to be an aircraft.
witness description: Individuals were localized in Sioux City, Iowa without specific identifying details provided in the record.
